message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CE, cs.MS, cs.NA, cs.DC. 

The paper discusses the software architecture and process for large-scale multiphysics simulation codes that make use of structured adaptive mesh refinement. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) and Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) sub-categories. The use of HPC platforms and the need for efficient solvers also suggest that the paper may belong to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-category. The paper may also be relevant to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category, given the challenges of running these codes on HPC platforms. Finally, the use of simulations in scientific research suggests that the paper may be relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.MS) sub-category, although this is less likely than the other sub-categories mentioned.
